item.title: Reinstalling the Bail Arm On Site
item.description: Part two of returning a repaired bail arm to service, focusing on alignment and installation in the field. What challenges come with on-site repairs?

media:content.media:title: Reinstalling the Bail Arm On Site
media:content.media:description: Part two of returning a repaired bail arm to service, focusing on alignment and installation in the field. What challenges come with on-site repairs?

item.title: Making a Flogging Spanner for Inspection
item.description: The process of crafting a flogging spanner used to inspect a strut cylinder. Why are custom tools sometimes essential in heavy maintenance work?

item.title: Building New Boom Lift Cylinders
item.description: The process of crafting new boom lift cylinders for a Franna crane, from machining to assembly. How are heavy-lift components designed for reliability?

item.title: From raw metal to precision machined parts
item.description: Watch raw metal take shape as it’s transformed into finished machined parts. This video highlights engineering skill, tooling, and accuracy inside the workshop. What makes precision machining so critical?

item.title: Machining Polyurethane Bushings
item.description: Watch the process of machining new bushings from polyurethane plastic, highlighting material handling and precision techniques. A clear view into workshop engineering and component production. Why is polyurethane often chosen for bushings?

item.title: Taking Apart a Large Horizontal Milling Machine
item.description: A step-by-step breakdown of dismantling a massive horizontal milling machine, focusing on access, safety, and component handling. What goes into servicing equipment of this size?

item.title: Replacing a Broken A-Frame Eye
item.description: A close look at repairing a broken eye on a truck A-frame using machining and welding techniques. How do precise repairs restore structural strength?

item.title: Understanding air arc gouging in the workshop
item.description: What is air arc gouging? This video explains how the process works, where it’s used, and why it’s effective in heavy equipment repair and earthmoving applications. When is air arc gouging the right solution?

item.title: Building a Rotary Earth Clamp
item.description: This video documents the process of creating a rotary earth clamp, focusing on design, fabrication, and workshop precision. A practical look at how functional industrial components come together. What factors matter most during the build?

item.title: Building a Tool Post Grinder Setup
item.description: This video shows the process of working on the motor, pulleys, and safety guard for a tool post grinder. A practical look at machining, alignment, and functional design in a workshop setting. What details matter most when building custom shop equipment?

item.title: Preparing the workshop with containers and storage
item.description: We’re setting up our workshop renovation using two containers and an igloo-style storage unit to improve space and workflow. A practical look at planning and organization. How do smart layouts improve workshop efficiency?

item.title: Repairing a damaged D8 bulldozer blade
item.description: See how a damaged blade on a Caterpillar D8 is repaired and reinforced for reliable service. This video focuses on structural repair, welding, and workshop precision. What goes into restoring strength at this scale?

item.title: Repairing a 90-Ton Excavator Tilt Bracket
item.description: Watch the repair process of a massive 90-ton excavator tilt bracket, from inspection to precision machining. A close look at heavy engineering and problem-solving at industrial scale. How are components this large restored to working condition?

item.title: Diagnosing a seized clevis issue
item.description: What started as a single fault revealed multiple issues with a seized clevis on a Franna crane. A practical breakdown of diagnosis, machining, and repair in the workshop. How do small problems turn into bigger ones?

item.title: A closer look at worn hydraulic seals
item.description: How old do you think these hydraulic seals really are? This video examines a cylinder failure, highlighting seal wear, material breakdown, and the signs machinists look for during inspection. When should seals be replaced?

item.title: Restoring worn thrust faces with line boring
item.description: We put the WS2 Plus Line Boring System to work restoring worn thrust faces back to specification. A detailed look at precision, alignment, and careful machining. What does it take to bring equipment back to spec?

item.title: Estimating weld passes on a heavy repair
item.description: This video focuses on a large-scale welding repair and the multiple weld passes required for strength and durability. A practical look at preparation, technique, and patience in heavy equipment work. How many passes would you expect?

item.title: Broaching keyways for a custom grinder pulley
item.description: A close look at broaching keyways into pulleys made for a heavy-duty tool post grinder. This video highlights precision machining and shop-made tooling in action. Why is accurate keyway broaching so important?

item.title: Repairing a cracked weld in a hydraulic cylinder
item.description: A step-by-step look at repairing a cracked weld in a hydraulic cylinder, with a focus on welding technique, machining, and safety checks. How do professionals ensure a reliable repair after failure?

item.title: Setting up an advanced metal spray system
item.description: We’re installing a modern metal spray system designed for precision surface repair and engineering applications. This video highlights setup, capabilities, and workshop integration. How does metal spray improve component lifespan?
